qas.question: How many terms may a president serve?
what may not be basis for political party?

context: On <a0_0>18 January 2014<a0_0/>, the interim government successfully institutionalised a more secular constitution. The president is elected to a <a1_0>four-year term<a1_0/> and may serve <a2_0>2 terms<a2_0/>. The <a3_0>parliament<a3_0/> may impeach the president. Under the constitution, there is a guarantee of gender equality and absolute freedom of thought. The military retains the ability to appoint the national Minister of Defence for the next 8 years. Under the constitution, political parties may not be based on "<a4_0>religion, race, gender or geography<a4_0/>".
